history.content:
As far as I know, the number of units taken does not effect your entrance. There's a cap on the total number of (lower-div) units that can be transferred. The wording seems to imply that no credit besides subject credit (used for satisfying degree reqs) will be given for upper-div units, though I remember my upper-div units counting.

There is nothing I can find so far as an official stance on how the number of units effects admissibility, though I do recall seeing a line somewhere that excessive units are grounds for rejection (but it's more so to make sure that a potential transfer can complete his/her degree under the 130 unit ceiling, so something like 100 semester units w/ upper-div is not going to be admitted). I wouldn't worry too much about taking upper-div, just be aware it may or may not transfer.

Per the admissions webpage: Students who wish to transfer to Berkeley from another UC campus are considered in light of their personal circumstances and the availability of space in their prospective major; these students must apply as junior transfers with a minimum of 60–80 semester units (not to exceed 80–120 quarter units). These units must be completed by the end of the spring prior to fall matriculation.

Edit: From the COE webpage: Applicants with excessive transferable semester units (89 or more from a four-year institution or those who complete coursework at a community college and then transfer to a four-year institution) are ineligible for admission. http://engineering.berkeley.edu/admissions/undergrad-admissions/prospective-junior-transfer-faqs

Per the admissions webpage: Students who wish to transfer to Berkeley from another UC campus are considered in light of their personal circumstances and the availability of space in their prospective major; these students must apply as junior transfers with a minimum of 60–80 semester units (not to exceed 80–120 quarter units). These units must be completed by the end of the spring prior to fall matriculation.

Hello, my friend is currently a sophomore at another UC, and wants to transfer here. She has 61 quarter units right now and will have 78 immediately after fall quarter finishes. She has some CC units for GE courses from the summer. Will her taking upper division CS impact her chances of getting in or her status with the admission office (specifically CS101 and CS102 which appear to be algorithms courses equivalent to 61B/170)? Also, will taking too many units affect anything? If so, is there a number? I've heard somewhere between 90-120 quarter units.
history.subject: L&S CS Transfer
